Determined is an open-source deep learning training platform that makes building models fast and easy. Determined enables you to:

  • Train models faster using state-of-the-art distributed training, without changing your model code
  • Automatically find high-quality models with advanced hyperparameter tuning from the creators of Hyperband
  • Get more from your GPUs with smart scheduling and cut cloud GPU costs by seamlessly using preemptible instances
  • Track and reproduce your work with experiment tracking that works out-of-the-box, covering code versions, metrics, checkpoints, and hyperparameters

Determined integrates these features into an easy-to-use, high-performance deep learning environment â€” which means you can spend your time building models instead of managing infrastructure.

Getting Started

  • The Quick Start provides a quick, hands-on introduction training a model, performing a hyperparameter search, and running a distributed training job on you local computer.
  • The Getting Started with xyz introduces you to sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat..

Introducing Determined

  • The System Architecture gives an architectural view of Determined components and workflows in on-premis and cloud environments, with GPU or CPU-only configurations.
  • The Features descriptions provide an overview of Determined functionality, capabilities, and conventions, and introduce you to essential concepts.

Training

  • Distributed Training demonstrates how to perform optimized distributed training with Determined to speed up the training of a single trial.
  • Hyperparameter Tuning covers the hyperparameter tuning machine learning workflow that involves appropriate data configuration, model architecture, and learning algorithm to produce an effective model.
  • Reproducibility describes Determined support for deterministic, reproducible machine learning experiments.

Administration Guide

  • The Basics section describes Determined CLI and cluster installation and operation in your local environment, which might involve your local development machine, an on-premise GPU cluster, or cloud resources.
  • Deploy on AWS explains how to install and run Determined on your Amazon Web Services (AWS).
  • Deploy on GCP explains how to install and run Determined on your Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • Deploy on Prem explains how to install and run Determined on machines you already have access to, whether a single laptop for local development or a fleet of multi-GPU servers.
  • Deploy on Kubernetes explains how to install and run Determined on a Kubernetes cluster.

Tutorials

  • Tutorials are simple, step-by-step guides about various topics to help you get started using Determined. These include:
    • PyTorch MNIST Tutorial
    • TensorFlow Keras Fashion MNIST Tutorial
    • Porting Tutorial
    • PyTorch MNIST Tutorial
    • TensorFlow Keras Fashion MNIST Tutorial

Reference

  • The Training API describes the training API interface between Determined and your application framework, such as Keras and TensorFlow, described in terms of training data loading, model architecture, and the underlying iterative optimization training algorithms.
  • The Trial API describes the inteface provided by Determined to create a Trial API model definition. The interface provides information such as the model architecture to use or the validation metrics that should be computed.
  • The Model Hub library interface makes it easy to train models using popular, third-party libraries with a Determined cluster. These include:
    • Huggingface Transformers
    • MMDetection
